messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/15/03 7:16:46 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
ecsamhill@... writes:

> That's the one. Some of his other books have been good, for their
> genre, but I thought this one was lousy, not just because of the killer
> unschoolers.
>
> Betsy
>

Yeah, that one definitely was not one of my favorites.. It was too bizarro in
a way that never came together to make any sense.

Teresa

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] OT / terrible homeschooler in fiction
messages.msgSnippet: ** PS  I read a James Patterson mystery novel (title lost to me) in which ... I read that book too.. GOSH, I can t remember the name of it either.. .. Was it
messages.messageBody:
**> PS I read a James Patterson mystery novel (title lost to me) in which
> there were hippie, Santa Cruz mountains, unschoolers who were incestous
> thrill killers.

I read that book too.. GOSH, I can't remember the name of it either.. ..
Was
it the one about the brothers and the tigers? **

That's the one. Some of his other books have been good, for their
genre, but I thought this one was lousy, not just because of the killer unschoolers.

Betsy
